Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Joe Biden has not said "one word" about the emergency in Texas, when in fact he approved an emergency declaration, held a call with the governor, and made statements on Twitter.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or specific examples to back up the assertion that Biden has not addressed the emergency in Texas.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of public remarks from Biden prior to Feb. 17 means he has ignored the matter, disregarding the fact that he approved the emergency declaration and held a call with the governor.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Biden did take action by approving the emergency declaration and holding a call with the governor.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that President Biden may have addressed the emergency through channels other than public remarks, such as the approved emergency declaration and the call with the governor.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging the actions taken by President Biden in response to the emergency in Texas.
Understate: The claim understates the actions taken by President Biden, such as the approved emergency declaration and the call with the governor.
